page.title: 16A NEW RAILWAY
page.content:
A new feature in the landscape to the south and west of Thorpe Willoughby is the main east coast diversion of the railway from London King's Cross to Edinburgh. This rail diversion is not shown on contemporary O.S. maps.
As a result of this diversion Selby has lost its status as a stop on the Inter-City route. Passengers now have to travel to York or Doncaster to connect with the main line. However, the new line cuts down journey times from York to London and it is the first new main line to be built in Britain for 60 years.
The railway had to be diverted because of the new Selby coalfield which undermines the old route. The new track is 12 miles long,has 14 new road bridges and cost over Â£2 million.
